sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"习惯，风俗，传统"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: habit, custom, manners, usage, practice, convention, tradition
means: habit ： 侧重于自然养成的，不易去掉的个人习惯。
custom ： 指一个国家、一个民族、一个地区或一个社会的习惯、行为方式或风俗习惯。也可指个人的习惯。
manners ： 指在某一时期或某一团体中盛行的社会礼仪或社会风俗模式。
usage ： 指持续时间长，为很多人公认采纳的惯例、习俗。
practice ： 常指习惯性的做法或行为。
convention ： 多指约定俗成的行为方式规则或公认的标准，或指艺术上公认的技巧。
tradition ： 广义指世代相传的伦理、行为规范和生活方式，特指因长久奉行而几乎具有法律效力的习惯、习俗，侧重历史意义。

sentence.Network_en: It was his invariable custom to have one whisky before his supper.
sentence.Network_cn: 晚饭前来杯威士忌，这是他一直以来的习惯。

sentence.Network_en: Furniture can also be custom-made to suit your own requirements.
sentence.Network_cn: 你也可以按照自己的要求定制家具。

sentence.Network_en: The married women of Shitamachi maintained the custom of blackening their teeth.
sentence.Network_cn: 下町的已婚女性还保留着把牙齿涂黑的习俗。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French coustume, based on Latin consuetudo, from consuetus, past participle of consuescere 'accustom', from con- (expressing intensive force) + suescere 'become accustomed'

entry.def: A custom is an activity, a way of behaving, or an event which is usual or traditional in a particular society or in particular circumstances.

example.ex: The custom of lighting the Olympic flame goes back centuries...
example.tran: 点燃奥林匹克圣火的习俗可以追溯到几个世纪前。

example.ex: Chung has tried to adapt to local customs.
example.tran: 钟努力去适应当地的风俗习惯。

entry.tran: 个人习惯;习性;惯常行为
entry.def: If it is your custom to do something, you usually do it in particular circumstances.

example.ex: It was his custom to approach every problem cautiously...
example.tran: 他习惯谨慎地处理每一个问题。

example.ex: As is the custom, police forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.
example.tran: 像往常一样，警方的法医专家对残骸进行了仔细的查看。

entry.def: If a shop has your custom, you regularly buy things there.

example.ex: You have the right to withhold your custom if you so wish...
example.tran: 如果你这么不想来，你可以不再光顾。

example.ex: Providing discounts is not the only way to win custom.
example.tran: 打折并不是招揽顾客的唯一途径。

entry.def: If you use custom to describe something such as a vehicle or a piece of clothing, you mean that it has been designed for one particular customer.

example.ex: Her one-of-a-kind custom garments are priced from one hundred dollars to more than a thousand dollars.
example.tran: 在她这里定做一件款型独一无二的衣服，价格从100美元到1,000美元以上不等。

means.word_mean: 2. a specific practice of long standing

sentences.sentence: "I have given this tailor my custom for many years"

means.word_mean: 1. made according to the specifications of an individual

means.word_mean: 习惯, 风俗, 惯例

sentences.en: It is the custom of foreigners to do so.
sentences.cn: 这种做法是外国人的习惯。

sentences.en: We would like to have your custom.
Did you have any trouble with the Customs?

jushi.english: The custom has now become a rule.
jushi.chinese: 那种习惯现已变为常规。

jushi.english: It was Tom's custom to get up early and go for a walk before breakfast.
jushi.chinese: 汤姆习惯早起床,并在早餐前散步。
